metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3933 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An integer overflow could occur when OpenEXR processes a crafted file on systems where size_t < 64 bits. This could cause an invalid bytesPerLine and maxBytesPerLine value, which could lead to problems with application stability or lead to other attack paths.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3933` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenexr24 - 2.3.0-6ubuntu0.5+esm1
openexr - 2.3.0-6ubuntu0.5+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ilmbase package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
openexr package in esm-apps/focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.3.0-6ubuntu0.5+esm1').
povray package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
